pageTitle: Tube, Bus, DLR, Tramlink and River services over the Easter holiday.
description: Planning by London Buses, together with the bus companies, will bring a Saturday service on just about every route for Good Friday.Normal bus services will operate on Easter Saturday and Sunday. On Easter Monday a Sunday service will operate. Route H20

title.title: Tube, Bus, DLR, Tramlink and River services over the Easter holiday.

texts: Transport for London today announced details of London travel arrangements over the Easter holiday weekend.
Planning byLondon Buses , together with the bus companies, will bring a Saturday service on just about every route for Good Friday.

Normal bus services will operate on Easter Saturday and Sunday. On Easter Monday a Sunday service will operate. Route H20 (which does not normally operate on a Sunday) will run during shopping hours between Ivybridge, Tesco and Hounslow Civic Centre on Easter Monday.
Mobility Buses will run a normal Friday service on Good Friday and no service will run on Easter Monday.
OnDocklands Light Railway a Saturday service will operate on Good Friday and Easter Monday. Normal services will run on the Easter Saturday and Sunday.
Croydon Tramlink will run a Saturday service on Good Friday. Normal tram services will operate on Easter Saturday and Sunday. On Easter Monday a Sunday service will be in operation.
TheRiver service will be running its summer timetable over the Easter break, with services running from Hampton Court to Greenwich.
London Underground will run the following services:
Good Friday - 9 April
A Saturday service will operate on all lines except the following:

Hammersmith \u0026 City and Circle line services between Edgware Road and Whitechapel will operate at 10 minute intervals. A rail replacement bus service will operate between Hammersmith and Baker Street.","District line:\u003cbr /\u003eA reduced District line service will operate between Putney Bridge and Wimbledon.","Central line:\u003cbr /\u003eThere will be no service on the Central line between Northolt and West Ruislip but a rail replacement bus service will operate.","Waterloo \u0026 City line:\u003cbr /\u003eThere will be no Waterloo \u0026 City line.","Stations closed:\u003cbr /\u003eThe following stations will be closed all day; Borough, Cannon Street, Chancery Lane, Mornington Crescent, Shoreditch and Temple."]}

For details about services check out http://www.tfl.gov.uk/ or www.tfl.gov.uk/tube telephone London Travel information on 020 7222 1234.
For more information please contact Transport for London Press Office on 020 7941 4141.
